snippet: The area’s economic comeback rides piggyback on low-wage jobs, on those who dip fries in boiling oil and pull flesh off the bones of factory chickens.
abstract: Michael Powell Gotham column notes the impossible mathematics under which city's minimum-wage laborers struggle to keep their lives intact; holds that the economic comebacks of the New York region are riding on the growth of low-wage jobs, especially in the fast-food business, and calls the corporate sector allowing these workers to bob along the poverty line shameless.
lead_paragraph: The area’s economic comeback rides piggyback on low-wage jobs, on those who dip fries in boiling oil and pull flesh off the bones of factory chickens.

headline.main: Making $7.75 an Hour, and Figuring There’s Little to Lose by Speaking Out
